meanings.definition: A person who plays a musical instrument, especially a flute or whistle.
meanings.sent1: The tootlers in the band played beautiful music at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The talented tootlers entertained the audience with their melodious tunes.
meanings.sent3: The tootlers at the park filled the air with sweet sounds on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The tootlers were like magical minstrels, enchanting all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The group of tootlers created a symphony of joy with their instruments.

meanings.definition: To play a musical instrument, especially a flute or whistle, in a light and casual manner.
meanings.sent1: She tootlers on her flute every evening to relax after a long day.
meanings.sent2: The children love to tootlers on their recorders during music class.
meanings.sent3: He tootlers on his whistle while walking in the park, spreading cheer around.
meanings.sent4: The musician tootlers on his flute, filling the room with soothing melodies.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, she would tootlers on her flute, serenading the night with music.
